SEARCH

Class LLVM

java.lang.Object
LLVM
public class LLVM extends Object
The LLVM class represents a code generator for LLVM intermediate representation. It generates LLVM code based on an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST).

    • LLVM

      public LLVM(AST ast)

  • Method Details

    • generateCode

      public void generateCode(ParseTree parseTree)
      Generates LLVM code based on the given parse tree. Depending of the label of the parse tree, a different function is called.
      Parameters:
      parseTree - The parse tree representing the program.

    • addCode

      public void addCode(String code)
      Appends the given code to the LLVM code with proper tabulation.
      Parameters:
      code - the code to be added

    • addNamedVariable

      public String addNamedVariable(String varname)
      Adds a named variable to the LLVM code and returns the variable name. If the variable is not already present, it is added to the list of named variables and the corresponding LLVM code is generated.
      Parameters:
      varname - the name of the variable to be added
      Returns:
      the name of the added variable

    • addNumberedVariable

      public String addNumberedVariable()
      Increments the numberedVariableCounter and returns the incremented value as a String for local variables.
      Returns:
      The incremented value of the numberedVariableCounter as a String.

    • addReadFunction

      public void addReadFunction()
      Adds a read function to the LLVM code. The read function reads an integer from the input and returns it.

    • addPrintFunction

      public void addPrintFunction()
      Adds a print function to the LLVM code. This function appends the necessary LLVM code to define a print function that prints an integer value to the console.

    • allocateVariables

      public void allocateVariables(ParseTree parseTree)
      Recursively allocates variables from the given parse tree. If a terminal node represents a variable name, it is added to the list of named variables. If a non-terminal node is encountered, the method is called recursively on its children.
      Parameters:
      parseTree - the parse tree to allocate variables from

    • program

      public void program(ParseTree parseTree)
      Generates LLVM code for the rule .
      Parameters:
      parseTree - The parse tree representing the program.

    • code

      public void code(ParseTree parseTree)
      Generates LLVM code for the rule .
      Parameters:
      parseTree - The parse tree to generate code for.

    • instlist

      public void instlist(ParseTree parseTree)
      Generates LLVM code for the rule .
      Parameters:
      parseTree - The parse tree to generate code for.

    • assign

      public void assign(ParseTree parseTree)
      Generates LLVM code for the rule .
      Parameters:
      parseTree - The parse tree to generate code for.

    • exprarith

      public String exprarith(ParseTree parseTree)

      Parameters:

    • prod

      public String prod(ParseTree parseTree)
      Generates LLVM code for the rule .
      Parameters:
      parseTree - The parse tree to generate code for.

    • unaryMinus

      public int unaryMinus(ParseTree parseTree, int minusCounter)
      Calculates the number of unary minus operators in the given parse tree.
      Parameters:
      parseTree - The parse tree to analyze.
      minusCounter - The current count of unary minus operators.
      Returns:
      The updated count of unary minus operators.

    • atom

      public String atom(ParseTree parseTree)
      This method takes a ParseTree as input and returns a String representing the atom. The atom can be a unary minus, an expression enclosed in parentheses, a variable name, or a number.
      Parameters:
      parseTree - The ParseTree representing the atom.
      Returns:
      The String representation of the atom.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the atom is invalid.

    • cond

      public String cond(ParseTree parseTree)
      Generates LLVM code for the rule .
      Parameters:
      parseTree - The parse tree to generate code for.
      Returns:
      The last numbered variable generated.

    • conj

      private String conj(ParseTree parseTree)
      Generates LLVM code for the rule .
      Parameters:
      parseTree - The parse tree to generate code for.
      Returns:
      The last numbered variable generated.
